title: Help: In class Hackathon and Forecasting Vompetition
Help: In class Hackathon and Forecasting Vompetition
Help: In class Hackathon and Forecasting Vompetition
text:
Read Data

library(readr)
train <- read_csv("train.csv")

Rows: 1035 Columns: 3
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (1): Date
dbl (2): ID, Value

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

#View(train)
train

# A tibble: 1,035 × 3
      ID Date       Value
   <dbl> <chr>      <dbl>
 1     1 01.01.2023  2246
 2     2 02.01.2023  3633
 3     3 03.01.2023  2982
 4     4 04.01.2023  2694
 5     5 05.01.2023  3512
 6     6 06.01.2023  3035
 7     7 07.01.2023  2773
 8     8 08.01.2023  2912
 9     9 09.01.2023  3806
10    10 10.01.2023  3239
# ℹ 1,025 more rows

title: Help: In class Hackathon and Forecasting Vompetition
text:
Convert data into tsiblle

library(dplyr)

train |>
  group_by(Date) |>
  summarise(n = n()) %>%
  filter(n > 1)

# A tibble: 2 × 2
  Date           n
  <chr>      <int>
1 30.05.2024     2
2 31.05.2024     2

title: Help: In class Hackathon and Forecasting Vompetition
text:
Convert data into tsible

library(dplyr)

train |>
  group_by(Date) |>
  summarise(n = n()) |>
  filter(n > 1)

# A tibble: 2 × 2
  Date           n
  <chr>      <int>
1 30.05.2024     2
2 31.05.2024     2



duplicates_with_counts <- train |>
  group_by(Date) |>
  filter(n() > 1) |>       # Keep only dates that appear more than once
  mutate(count = n()) |>   # Add a column showing how many times this date appears
  ungroup() |>
  arrange(Date)

duplicates_with_counts

# A tibble: 4 × 4
     ID Date       Value count
  <dbl> <chr>      <dbl> <int>
1   516 30.05.2024  3257     2
2   881 30.05.2024  4528     2
3   517 31.05.2024  3463     2
4   882 31.05.2024  4318     2



# Correct the dates for rows 881 and 882
train <- train %>%
  mutate(Date = case_when(
    ID == 881 ~ "30.05.2025",
    ID == 882 ~ "31.05.2025",
    TRUE ~ Date
  ))


train |>
  group_by(Date) |>
  filter(n() > 1) |>       # Keep only dates that appear more than once
  mutate(count = n()) |>   # Add a column showing how many times this date appears
  ungroup() |>
  arrange(Date)

# A tibble: 0 × 4
# ℹ 4 variables: ID <dbl>, Date <chr>, Value <dbl>, count <int>



# --- Convert to tsibble ---
df_ts <- train |>
  mutate(Date = dmy(Date)) |>        # Convert "01.01.2023" to Date format
  as_tsibble(index = Date)

df_ts

# A tsibble: 1,035 x 3 [1D]
      ID Date       Value
   <dbl> <date>     <dbl>
 1     1 2023-01-01  2246
 2     2 2023-01-02  3633
 3     3 2023-01-03  2982
 4     4 2023-01-04  2694
 5     5 2023-01-05  3512
 6     6 2023-01-06  3035
 7     7 2023-01-07  2773
 8     8 2023-01-08  2912
 9     9 2023-01-09  3806
10    10 2023-01-10  3239
# ℹ 1,025 more rows

title: Help: In class Hackathon and Forecasting Vompetition
section: Split data to training and test
text:
Split data to training and test

# Find the last date
last_day <- max(df_ts$Date)

# First day of the last month
first_test_day <- floor_date(last_day, "month")

# Split
train <- df_ts %>% filter(Date < first_test_day)
test  <- df_ts %>% filter(Date >= first_test_day)

head(train)

# A tsibble: 6 x 3 [1D]
     ID Date       Value
  <dbl> <date>     <dbl>
1     1 2023-01-01  2246
2     2 2023-01-02  3633
3     3 2023-01-03  2982
4     4 2023-01-04  2694
5     5 2023-01-05  3512
6     6 2023-01-06  3035

tail(train)

# A tsibble: 6 x 3 [1D]
     ID Date       Value
  <dbl> <date>     <dbl>
1   999 2025-09-25  4666
2  1000 2025-09-26  5891
3  1001 2025-09-27  6150
4  1002 2025-09-28  5588
5  1003 2025-09-29  4959
6  1004 2025-09-30  5339

head(test)

# A tsibble: 6 x 3 [1D]
     ID Date       Value
  <dbl> <date>     <dbl>
1  1005 2025-10-01  6751
2  1006 2025-10-02  6021
3  1007 2025-10-03  6146
4  1008 2025-10-04  5802
5  1009 2025-10-05  4847
6  1010 2025-10-06  4478

tail(test)

# A tsibble: 6 x 3 [1D]
     ID Date       Value
  <dbl> <date>     <dbl>
1  1030 2025-10-26  5618
2  1031 2025-10-27  4583
3  1032 2025-10-28  5577
4  1033 2025-10-29  5028
5  1034 2025-10-30  5216
6  1035 2025-10-31  6515



library(feasts)
train |>
  autoplot(Value)







train |>
  ACF(Value) |>
  autoplot() +
  labs(title = "ACF Plot of Value")







train |>
  PACF(Value) |>
  autoplot() +
  labs(title = "PACF Plot of Value")









train |>
  mutate(Value_diff = difference(Value)) |>  # Take first difference
  ACF(Value_diff, na_action = "omit") |>    # Compute ACF
  autoplot() +
  labs(title = "ACF Plot of Differenced Value")

Warning: The `...` argument of `PACF()` is deprecated as of feasts 0.2.2.
ℹ ACF variables should be passed to the `y` argument. If multiple variables are
  to be used, specify them using `vars(...)`.


Warning: ACF currently only supports one column, `Value_diff` will be used.










forecast::findfrequency(train)

Registered S3 method overwritten by 'quantmod':
  method            from
  as.zoo.data.frame zoo 


[1] 7



sarima_auto <- train |>
  model(
    auto = ARIMA(Value ~ pdq() + PDQ(period = 7))
  )

# View model summary
report(sarima_auto)

Series: Value 
Model: ARIMA(2,1,2)(0,0,2)[7] 

Coefficients:
          ar1     ar2      ma1      ma2    sma1    sma2
      -0.0570  0.3088  -0.4037  -0.4191  0.3404  0.1705
s.e.   0.1963  0.0802   0.1981   0.1643  0.0331  0.0287

sigma^2 estimated as 494379:  log likelihood=-7996.06
AIC=16006.11   AICc=16006.22   BIC=16040.49
